intro: Prostanthera splendens, commonly known as the splendour mint, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its leaves are often aromatic and have a mint-like scent, which is a defining feature of the genus Prostanthera. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and heathland environments.
